thread.title: Doull promoted to key executive post in Black & Veatch’s Power business

author: cnbc.com
title: Doull promoted to key executive post in Black & Veatch’s Power business
text:
OVERLAND PARK, Kan., May 03, 2018 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Black & Veatch, a global leader in design, construction and power solutions, today announced the promotion of Jim Doull to executive vice president of engineering, procurement and construction (EPC) in the company’s power business in the Americas and EMEIA.
Doull, a 28-year Black & Veatch professional, leads oversight of all facets of large-scale EPC projects in the Americas, Europe, the Middle East, India and Africa, including safety, strategy, recruitment of new business and project execution. Doull will also ensure completion of the current projects assignments in Vietnam.
Doull’s tenure at Black & Veatch has included roles in senior management and leadership, including senior vice president and senior project director of the company’s energy operations in Ann Arbor, Michigan, and in Canada. He also served in Canada as senior project director of the Alberta Oil Sands Cogeneration Project and the ENMAX Shepard Energy Centre Project in Alberta. His titles also have included chief estimator, project manager, and construction operations manager.
“Jim has distinguished himself with his diverse background that has helped lead Black & Veatch’s charge with complex infrastructure projects in some of the world’s leading energy markets,” said Ed Walsh, president of Black & Veatch’s Power business. “With considerable global experience, Jim has demonstrated a flexibility to take on increasingly demanding assignments with tremendous commitment and skill.”
Doull has a bachelor’s degree in construction management from Kansas State University and graduated from the Global CEO Program at the University of Pennsylvania’s Wharton School of Business.
About Black & Veatch
Black & Veatch is an employee-owned, global leader in building critical human infrastructure in Energy, Water, Telecommunications and Government Services. Since 1915, we have helped our clients improve the lives of people in over 100 countries through consulting, engineering, construction, operations and program management. Our revenues in 2017 were US$3.4 billion. Follow us on www.bv.com and in social media.
